column2:
U.S. Census Bureau's American Community Survey (ACS) tables via data.census.gov.

Suggested Citation:
SHADAC analysis of [DATA SOURCE], State Health Compare, SHADAC, University of Minnesota, statehealthcompare.shadac.org, Accessed [DATE].

Data are not available for 2020. Data collection for the 2020 American Community Survey (ACS) was substantially disrupted by the the COVID-19 pandemic, leading to measurable data quality issues in the 2020 survey. As a result, the U.S. Census Bureau chose not to release standard, 1-year estimates from the 2020 ACS. More information is available via the Census Bureau."
Measurement of disparities in income in each state. Higher values indicate more income inequality with 0 indicating perfect equality and 1 indicating perfect inequality.
